results.title: Brazing a lap joint
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Gas Welding”.
In brazing a lap joint, the film demonstrates the selection of the welding tip, and the application of flux to the join.

results.title: Braze welding
results.brief_description:
Episode number 7 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Demonstrates the method of braze welding, a bonding process used to join similar or dissimilar metals by an alloy which has a lower melting point.

results.title: Three types of welds
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Gas Welding”
Part of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures, through flame adjustments. This part describes the types of welds that can be used in gas welding.

results.title: Butt welds in sheet metal
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Episode five in a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding. This film demonstrates how welding on a sheet of metal and then welding with a rod are necessary steps before proceeding to butt weld two pieces of metal together.

results.title: Flame adjustment and tip cleaning
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Shows how to adjust the blow pipe flame and clean the tip to ensure a sound weld and cut.

results.title: Gas welding equipment
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Gas Welding”.
Part one of a series of nine short instructional films showing methods for oxyacetylene welding from setting-up procedures through flame adjustments. Shows types of welds, cutting methods and closing down procedures. Close-up viewing of the equipment and materials being worked gives the learner an operator’s perspective into the art of oxyacetylene welding.

results.title: Patch from scratch
results.creator_credit: Colin Grubb and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Gardening Australia”.
Witness Peter Cundall transform a patch of exhausted lawn into a productive vegetable garden yielding a cornucopia of fresh organic vegetables. Over an 18 month period the viewer follows the cycle of sowing, fertilising and harvesting through Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter. Peter demonstrates how to rotate the beds with legumes, brassicas, root crops and companion plants to maintain healthy crops and fertile soil, and how to keep pests and diseases at bay. Vegetables shown being grown include Peas, Beans, Lettuce, Endive, Tomatoes, Cabbage, Broccoli, Cauliflower, Garlic, Sweet Corn, Pumpkin, Cucumber, Zucchini, Swedes, Carrots, Onions, Capsicums, Potatoes, Oca and Artichokes.

results.title: Why did you leave such a beautiful place?
results.creator_credit: Margaret O'Connell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Margaret O’Connell tells of how she moved to be with her sister in Geelong, of her first days at Brintons carpet factory and how her loneliness was soon replaced by the family she made there. She join the Equal Opportunity and Consultative Committees and, when the factory closed in 2008, had been there for 32 years.
